content: How can I extract the last four characters from a string in Python? For example, if I have the string "aaaabbbb", I wish to capture the last four characters and store them in a separate string.

To extract the last four characters from a string in Python, you can use slicing. Here is a simple way to do it:

```python
# Define the original string
original_string = "aaaabbbb"

# Extract the last four characters
last_four_chars = original_string[-4:]

# Print the result
print(last_four_chars)
```

In this example, `original_string[-4:]` uses slicing to get the last four characters of the string. The `-4` index means "start from the fourth character from the end" and the `:` means "go to the end of the string". This will store the substring "bbbb" in `last_four_chars`.
